games

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • games.Game
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MoreLess

    public abstract class Game
extends Object
    Game is the class representing a game.

    The games represented by the Game class are games where it is necessary to discover either a number (MoreLess game) or a combination of number or color (mastermind)

    A game is initiated by starting with the game mode provided as a constructor's parameter (call of the play methods playChallenger() playDefenser() playDuel())
    A game can generate a mystery number mysteryNumberGeneration()
    A game can compare a proposal provided with the mystery number compareNumber(ArrayList)
    A game can initiate a message of victory or defeat victory() defeat()
    Version:
    1.0.1
    Author:
    BRUCELLA2

    • Field Detail

      • gameName

        GameNames gameName
        Game's name

        This variable is initialized by the constructor of the class.
        See Also:
        getGameName(), setGameName(GameNames)

      • gameMode

        GameModes gameMode
        game's mode

        This variable is initialized by a parameter provided to the constructor of the class.
        This variable is used to define how the game will run.
        See Also:
        getGameMode(), setGameMode(GameModes)

      • mysteryNumber

        ArrayList<Integer> mysteryNumber
        Mystery Number to Discover

        Each digit constituting the number is contained in an ArrayList of integer.
        The mystery number is generated randomly () or from a data entered by the user.
        See Also:
        getMysteryNumber(), setMysteryNumber(ArrayList), mysteryNumberGeneration()

      • nbDigitsMysteryNumber

        int nbDigitsMysteryNumber
        Number of digits constituting the mystery number
        See Also:
        getNbDigitsMysteryNumber(), setNbDigitsMysteryNumber(int)

      • nbRemainingTries

        int nbRemainingTries
        Number of remaining attempts to complete the game

        This variable is initialized in the constructor.
        When nbRemainingTries arrives at 0, the game must end. //TODO à intégrer dans le SETTER
        See Also:
        getNbRemainingTries(), setNbRemainingTries(int)

      • players

        ArrayList<Player> players
        Players list

        Players are stored in ArrayList of player.
        This list is empty when the game is created. Players are added when the game starts (play methods)

        (currently not used, players are created and used locally except for duel mode)
        See Also:
        getPlayers(), setPlayers(ArrayList)

      • display

        Display display
        display is used to display the different elements of the game.
        See Also:
        getDisplay(), setDisplay(Display)

      • endGame

        boolean endGame
        endGame indicates whether the game should end.
        See Also:
        isEndGame(), setEndGame(boolean)

        See Also:

      • mysteryNumberGeneration

        public void mysteryNumberGeneration()
        This method generates a mystery number.

        This method is based on the number of mystery digits that constitue the mystery number.
        The generated digits are integers between 0 and 9.

      • defeat

        protected void defeat()
        This method is used to end the game by indicating that the player has lost.
        The message is "Dommage ! Vous avez perdu" followed by the correct answer unless the game mode is the defender.

      • victory

        protected void victory()
        This method is used to end the game by indicating that the player has won.
        The message is "Bravo ! Vous avez gagné"

      • equality

        protected void equality()
        This method is used to end the game by indicating an equality between the player and the computer.
        This message is "Personne n'a gagné"

      • compareNumber

        public abstract String compareNumber(ArrayList<Integer> pNumberToCompare)
        This method allows to compare the number proposed in the parameter with the mystery number

        This method is redefined in the different girls' classes.
        Parameters:
        pNumberToCompare - The number to be compared to the mystery number.
        Returns:
        The result of the comparison in the form of a String

      • playChallenger

        public abstract void playChallenger()
        This method starts the game in Challenger mode.

        This method is redefined in the different daughter's classes.

      • playDefenser

        public abstract void playDefenser()
        This method starts the game in Defender mode

        This method is redefined in the different daughter's classes.

      • playDuel

        public abstract void playDuel()
        This method starts the game in Duel mode

        This method is redefined in the different daughter's classes.
